moves.1. f4: And yet another annotation from freddy's second project.  We pick up the story at the 9th move.
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 g6 3. e4 dxe4 4. Ng5 Nf6: The Bishop, strong and pure, seeks to control the a1-h8 diagonal.
moves.10. Nc3: It was expected that White would move Ne6, as this has been a most utilized move.  However, the White Liege deploys his other Knight to what he thought to be the safe and protected confines of c3.
moves.10... Bxc3: The DSB, pure of heart, knows this Knight doth harbor evil intent.  And as such, he takes decisive action.  In so doing, he lays down his life for his King.
moves.11. dxc3 h5: Black's quiet foot soldier informs White's LSB that his presence is a blight upon all that is good.
moves.12. Be6: Rather rudely, the LSB further immerses himself in Black's demesne.  His presence here was not planned upon and caused fear among Black's populace.
moves.12... Nd7: The bugles sound as The Black Knight enters into the foray.  The King, brave to a fault, does not seek safety.
moves.13. Be3: White's DSB comes forth, further constricting Black's King.
moves.13... Nc5: Hooray!  The Black Knight rides to his King's defense.
moves.14. Rd1: An ominous portent, this.  White's rook threatens Her Ladyship.  The Black King has foolishly refused to move to safety.  These are dangerous times.  Black's Queen sends word of her plan to Her King and Sir Knight.  They are aghast--"No fair Lady, I beg thee! Do not do this thing!"  The Queen, her eyes fierce and hard, brooks no defiance.  "I do what you know I must and nothing less than what you would do were you in my place.  White is strangling our land and our people."  Sir Knight, tears in his eyes, nods and does his duty.
moves.14... Nxe6 15. Rxd8 Nxd8: They will sing songs of your bravery, My Lady.
moves.16. Nxe4 Ne6: Sir Knight hastens back to the field!
moves.17. O-O Rad8: Black's rook claims the file for his people.
moves.18. Nd2 b6: And finally, after the loss of his Queen, the King realizes that his safety is paramount.
moves.19. Nc4 Kb7 20. Ne5: White's Knight looks to fork Black's rooks or perhaps attack the foot soldier at g6.
moves.21. f5: With this move, Black's rook at g8 thinks mayhap there be a chance to simplify.  Though this may cost him his life, he is content in the knowledge that he will soon be with his Queen.
moves.21... gxf5 22. Rxf5 Rd1+: With grim determination, the Rook on d8 bids farewell to his brother Rook--and strikes into the heart of White!
moves.25. g4: "What is this?" asks a surprised foot soldier--"I will gladly exchange my life for yours."
moves.25... hxg4 26. Nxg4 Rb1: And now Black's Rook begins to seek his vengeance.
moves.27. h4 Rxb2 28. Bh6: An attack on Sir Knight?  Whilst the safety of White's King is compromised?
moves.28... Rxc2+ 29. Ke1 Nh7: Sir Knight proclaims, "My brother gave his life dispatching your Queen--It shall not be in vain.  White foot soldier, you shall not pass!"
moves.30. Bg7: White's Bishop, in his attempt to save the lonely and isolated foot soldier at c3, inadvertently sacrifices the life of his Knight.
moves.30... Rg2: With only thoughts of revenge, the Black Rook sets his sights...
moves.32. h6 Rg2: Black's Rook now imprisons the White King.
moves.33. Kd1 Kc6: The Black King, humbled by the courage of his people, decides he himself will escort his foot soldier to promotion.
moves.34. Kc1 Kd5 35. Kb1 e5: It is at this point, the White King departs the field.  He fought well but this day was not to be his.

gameName: The Annotation Project II - The Courage of the Queen
